meanings.definition: An outline or summary of the main points of a course of study or text.
meanings.sent1: The teacher handed out the syllabus at the beginning of the semester.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to review the syllabus to understand the course requirements.
meanings.sent3: The syllabus seemed like a roadmap for the entire semester.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed syllabus was a treasure map guiding students through the subject.
meanings.sent5: The syllabus was like a recipe, listing all the ingredients needed for success in the class.

meanings.definition: A list of topics or books to be studied in a particular course.
meanings.sent1: I checked the syllabus to see which chapters we would cover next.
meanings.sent2: The syllabus included a variety of interesting readings for the semester.
meanings.sent3: The syllabus looked like a menu of knowledge waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent4: The syllabus was a treasure trove of information waiting to be uncovered.
meanings.sent5: The syllabus was a garden of learning, with each topic blooming like a flower.
